Who is the Volunteer Economy?

The Volunteer Economy is a 501c3 charity created by serial entrepreneur and founder, Paul Shirley, in 2009. The WAVE charity financially sponsors the WAVE Commons, a non-profit member-owned collaborative that gives individuals from all walks of life the opportunity to put their unique gifts to work by connecting them with a broad range of volunteer opportunities.

Creating access to opportunities for academic & life success

Our Mission

To create a new Volunteer Economy – where time is currency and people can convert volunteer time into rewards for themselves and others.

Our Vision

To enable academic and life success for all who volunteer.

Get Involved

Donating to The Volunteer Economy helps grow the program to other communities and launch new innovative tools and applications.

Contact Us Donate Now

Values

Our Values Drive Us

Trust

Being trustworthy; speaking and acting with utmost care and integrity.

Inclusion

Everyone belongs and is valued; unique gifts are honored and respected.

Service

Generously sharing time, talents and treasure to benefit others.

Accountability

Doing one’s best; being responsible; acting in the best interests of others.

Partner Organizations

Brief History

Serving and Sharing for the Common Good

  1. Paul Shirley starts The World Alliance for the Volunteer Economy (WAVE)

    2009

  2. The WAVE charity financially sponsors the WAVE Commons, a non-profit member-owned collaborative

    2009

  3. The Volunteer Economy launches first release of web applications.

    August 2018

Meet The Team

Kristen Muzzy

President, The Face, Voice and Trusting Love Story of WAVE

Ms Muzzy is a talented and courageous leader who has faced Great Suffering in her life only to rise above it all to find Great Love in her service to humanity. Kristen’s journey of survival, perseverance and hope illustrates how brokenness in one’s life can be healed through Divine Love flowing through trustworthy relationships.

Kristen has built her exceptional professional record upon decades of proven executive level leadership in finance & audting, business development, manufacturing operations, public relations, sales, marketing, and software development with a variety of corporations. Her track record of building high-performing teams that achieve aggressive goals on tight schedules, along with her deep passion for making a difference for all people in the world, makes her the perfect leader for The World Alliance for the Volunteer Economy.

Paul Shirley

Founder, Chairman

Dr. Shirley is a serial entrepreneur who cofounded and successfully led the first virtual aerospace company in the world. He is a native son of Rochester, IN who helped advance the Star Wars program while serving in the US Air Force. Paul’s interests in new technologies and deep concern for the peace and well-being of all people compelled him to become a full time volunteer social entrepreneur and create WAVE, the World Alliance for the Volunteer Economy, where all people can realize life success through volunteering.

Dan Gerry

Executive Director of WAVE Charities

Dan has a background in Behavioral Psychology with extensive experience in neuroscience informed Leadership and Organization Development consulting and training with manufacturing, Government, for-profit and non-profit organizations in the US, Europe and the Far East. He is past Chair of the Albuquerque Business-Education Compact and active with education advocacy, community development and Veterans support services.

Mathis Shinnick

Secretary/Treasurer, Director

Mr. Shinnick has built technology, asset management and financial services companies in Asia, the U.S. and Europe, and led organizations with over $300 million in annual revenues. He is currently CEO of Optipulse Inc, a new laser communications company pioneering ultra high speed Broadband networks that are 25% of the cost of today’s optical cable systems.

Michael R. Stanford

Director

Mr. Stanford has a strong background in finance and banking, currently serving as President of Payday Human Capital Management, providing professional, financial and human resources services for clients across the US. He’s also the owner of Defiant Wisdom LLC investment and consulting and serves as Executive Consultant with Golden Returns Capital, LLC Venture Fund.

Joe Sciabica

Directorn

Mr. Sciabica is the President of United Technology Corporation in Dayton OH, a 250-person professional services company geographically dispersed across the United States. He has leveraged his Chemical Engineering, Systems Management and National Security Policy degrees to serve in key past positions including Executive Director, Air Force Research Laboratories and Director, Air Force Civil Engineer Center.

Jon Kulaga, PhD

Director

Dr. Kulaga is the President of Ohio Christian University and has nearly 30 years of higher education experience that includes academics, advancement (fund raising), and student life/development. He has held senior positions at Asbury University, Kansas State University and Spring Arbor University, while contributing to/co-authoring six published books.

Kamil Agi, PhD

Director

Dr. Agi is President-CEO at SensorComm Technologies, Inc. For over 20 years, Dr. Agi has led the development of advanced technology solutions for law enforcement, firefighters and military. He initiated early development of IoT (internet of things) applications in 2010-2011. At SensorComm, he identified the core IP, negotiated license agreements and is leading the commercialization of the world’s most sensitive NOx emission sensor.

Tim Tamerler

Director

Mr. Tamerler currently serves as the Executive Director of Village Square Technologies, WAVE’s for-profit economic engine. With his background in computer systems design and aerospace management experience with Shafer Corp, Tim continues to provide technical consulting services and pro-bono volunteer support in the Houston, TX area.
